_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Policy:  The Owner, management and employees of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Drexel are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and law enforcement personnel to mitigate any release to residents and the environment of our community.



Facility information:  The primary activity at the facility is the storage and sales of fertilizer to farm producers in our area.  Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Drexel is a new installation.



a.    Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a crop production  nutrient.



b.    The maximum quantity stored would be 140,000 pounds.



Accidental Release Prevention Program:  The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61-1" published by the American National Standards institute, Inc.  After normal duty hours the Drexel Police Department inspects our area, approximately every two hours.  Anything out of the ordinary is reported to our 24 hour telephone number and the police take necessary actions.  The Drexel Fire Department conducts an annual fire inspection of the facility.



Five-Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years as this is a new installation



Emergency Response Program:  Our facility has coordinated with the local responders and we do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.



a.    Additional Facility Emergency contact: Mr. Trevor Hurt, Manager, (913) 594-1836



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility.  The major safety improvement planned is to replace site gauge.



For further information contact Mr. Trevor Hurt, Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Drexel, 123 West Main, Drexel, MO, (816) 657-2111.
